oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Insurance maps of Chicago, Illinois, Volume E
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanborn Map Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fire risk assessment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scale 1:600. 50 ft. to 1 in.
Fire insurance map hand colored to show building construction, locations of windows and doors, and available water facilities.
Partial cadastral map.

Shows towns of Blue Island, Bremen (or TInley Park), Burnside, Chicago Heights, Clifton, Columbia Heights, Detroit, Fernwood, Gano, Glenwood, Harvey, Homewood, Kensington, Matteson, Morgan Park, Mt. Greenwood, New Chicago, Orland, Palos Springs, Pullman, Purington, Riverdale, Roseland, South Holland, Thornton, Tinley Park, Washington Heights, West Pullman, Wireton Park and Worth.
Also shows factories, commercial occupancy of buildings, property boundaries, and house and block numbers.
Sheets numbered 1-139 title page, key map, and street index on 3 unnumbered sheets.
Originally issued as bound volume
Symbol key on key map sheet.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: [Chicago packing houses and Union Stock Yards. sheet 16.]
Title on map sheet: Stock Yards.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanborn Map Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fire insurance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scale [ca. 1:854]. Not 50 ft. to an in.
Includes text and notes
Title supplied by cataloger.
Reduced photocopy.
Includes corrections of May 1918.
Shows Darling & Co. stock yards.
Shows industrial complex at the intersection of Paradise Av. and Cahokia Road including Commercial Acid Co., C.H. Fulton, Consolidated Oil Refining Co., and Indiahoma Oil Refining Co.
Fire insurance map hand colored to show building construction and use, locations of windows and doors, and available water facilities.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Insurance maps of Urbana, Champaign County, Illinois
Urbana, Ill., Oct. 1923
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanborn Map Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fire insurance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fire insurance map hand colored to show building construction, locations of windows and doors, elevators, and available water facilities.
Also shows factories, commercial occupancy of buildings, property boundaries and house and block numbers.
Originally issued as bound volume.
Includes key to building colors and other features of construction; notes on water facilities, fire department, population, street surfaces, and prevailing winds; and location map.
Sheets numbered 1-39; title page on unnumbered sheet.
Index to streets, additions and subdivisions on title sheet; index to map sheets on sht. 1.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Insurance maps of Joliet, Illinois, Vol. 1
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanborn Map Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fire risk assessment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: ""Symbol legends on key map leaves."
Map leaves in volume 2 numbered 201-291; title page, key map, and street index on 3 unnumbered leaves.
Volume 2 includes Rockdale and shows the area east of the Des Plaines River that is south of 4th Avenue and the area west of the Des Plaines River.
Map leaves in volume 1 numbered 1-81; title page, key map, street index, and ""Map of congested district of Joliet, Ill"" on 4 unnumbered leaves.
Volume 1 includes ""part of Lockport and Joliet townships"" and shows the area east of the Des Plaines River and north of 4th Avenue.
Also shows factories, commercial occupancy of buildings, property boundaries and house and block numbers.
Partial cadastral map.
"Fire insurance map colored to show building construction, locations of windows and doors, elevators, and available water facilities.""

Symbol key on sheet 5."
""Rascher's birds eye view of the Chicago packing houses & Union Stock Yards, Chicago, Ill.""--plate 2-3. Birds eye view oriented with north toward the upper left.
Index to company facilities and ""special hazards"" on sheet 1.
""Copyrighted 1890 by Chas. Rascher.""
Organized as single, double, and triple page plates.
Most plates include map or plan with birds eye view of buildings.
"Fire insurance map hand colored to show building construction and available water facilities.
